TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi abstract beforefieldinit HttpStaticObjectsCollectionBase extends System.Object implements class System.Collections.ICollection, class System.Collections.IEnumerable

Docs.summary: Serves as the base class for classes that provide a collection of application-scoped objects for the property.

remarks.format:
## Remarks The <xref:System.Web.HttpStaticObjectsCollectionBase> class is an abstract class that contains the same members as the <xref:System.Web.HttpStaticObjectsCollection> class. The <xref:System.Web.HttpStaticObjectsCollectionBase> class lets you create derived classes that are like the <xref:System.Web.HttpStaticObjectsCollection> class, but that you can customize and that work outside the ASP.NET pipeline. When you perform unit testing, you typically use a derived class to implement members with customized behavior that fulfills the scenario you are testing.
The <xref:System.Web.HttpStaticObjectsCollectionWrapper> class derives from the <xref:System.Web.HttpStaticObjectsCollectionBase> class. The <xref:System.Web.HttpStaticObjectsCollectionWrapper> class serves as a wrapper for the <xref:System.Web.HttpStaticObjectsCollection> class. At run time, you typically use an instance of the <xref:System.Web.HttpStaticObjectsCollectionWrapper> class to call members of the <xref:System.Web.HttpStaticObjectsCollection> object.

MemberSignature.Value: .method familyhidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor() cil managed

Docs.summary: Initializes the class for use by an inherited class instance. This constructor can only be called by an inherited class.

MemberSignature.Value: public virtual void CopyTo (Array array, int index);
.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void CopyTo(class System.Array array, int32 index) cil managed

Docs.param: The one-dimensional array that is the destination of the elements that are copied from the collection. The array must have zero-based indexing.
The zero-based index in array at which to begin copying.
Docs.summary: When overridden in a derived class, copies the elements of the collection to an array, starting at the specified index in the array.
When overridden in a derived class, gets the number of objects in the collection.
Docs.value: The number of objects in the collection.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance class System.Collections.IEnumerator GetEnumerator() cil managed

Docs.summary: When overridden in a derived class, returns an enumerator that can be used to iterate through the collection.
Docs.returns: An object that can be used to iterate through the collection.

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance object GetObject(string name) cil managed

Docs.param: The case-insensitive name of the object to return.
Docs.summary: When overridden in a derived class, returns the object that has the specified name from the collection.
Docs.returns: The object that is specified by .

Docs.summary: When overridden in a derived class, gets a value that indicates whether the collection is read-only.
Docs.value: if the collection is read-only; otherwise, .

Docs.summary: When overridden in a derived class, gets a value that indicates whether the collection is thread-safe.
Docs.value: if the collection is thread-safe; otherwise, .

MemberSignature.Value: public virtual object this[string name] { get; }

Docs.param: The case-insensitive name of the object to get.
Docs.summary: When overridden in a derived class, gets the object that has the specified name from the collection.
Docs.value: The object that is specified by .

Docs.summary: When overridden in a derived class, gets a value that indicates whether the collection has been accessed.
Docs.value: if the collection has never been accessed; otherwise, .

MemberSignature.Value: .method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void Serialize(class System.IO.BinaryWriter writer) cil managed

Docs.param: The object to use to write the serialized collection to a stream or encoded string.
Docs.summary: When overridden in a derived class, writes the contents of the collection to a object.
When overridden in a derived class, gets an object that can be used to synchronize access to the collection.
Docs.value: An object that can be used to synchronize access to the collection.
